projectMesh.title: Mesh
projectMesh.description: An interactive webpage for an art installation
projectMesh.about: Mesh is a collaborative effort between myself and the artist Lara Christen located in Cardiff, Wales, UK. It utilizes JavaScript animations to create an interactive webpage that supports an art exhibit on queer ecology.
projectMesh.thumbnailAlt: A black screen with white dots scattered across it, with the word mesh in the center

braveNW.title: BraveNW
braveNW.description: Data Exploration for the New World MMO Game
braveNW.technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Typescript, MongoDB, node.js, express.js
braveNW.about: BraveNW was created as a fan website for the New World MMORPG from Amazon Games, as a way to explore the complex economics of the game. At the websiteâ€™s peak, it served over 10,000 users from around the globe a day with information about in-game probabilities and visualization tools to explore the in-game item networks. It also included preliminary functionality for organizing large scale 50v50 player-versus-player events for  the game.
braveNW.thumbnailAlt: A webpage with a list of catagories on the left side, and edge list at the bottom center, directions how to use it at the top center, and information about the selected edges on the right.

projectBraveNW.title: BraveNW
projectBraveNW.description: A website that was created to help explore the data from New World
projectBraveNW.about: This webpage was originaly built to explore data that had been scraped from the game before it was released. After the game came out we started implementing a utility for organising the 50 vs 50 pvp event that is in the game.
projectBraveNW.thumbnailAlt: A webpage with a list of catagories on the left side, and edge list at the bottom center, directions how to use it at the top center, and information about the selected edges on the right.

projectBraveNWdb.title: BraveNW-DB
projectBraveNWdb.about: After creating the data exploration part of BraveNW, we decided to expand the project to help with 'Wars' a 50 v 50 pvp event that happens in the game. Unfortunately before this was finished, me and the person I was working on this with lost interest, and stopped playing the game.
projectBraveNWdb.thumbnailAlt: The terminal output of mocha tests testing the functionality of the controller functions of MongoDB.

projectStatMiner.title: StatMiner
projectStatMiner.description: Computer Vision tool for extracting scores from Overwatch 2
projectStatMiner.about: StatMiner is a computer vision tool I built as my final year project. Built on Tesseract 5 and openCV, it analyzes videos of the popular game Overwatch 2 and extracts information from the in-game scoreboard for future use in data analytics.
projectStatMiner.thumbnailAlt: a picture of a Overwatch 2 scoreboard with boxes drawn around sections, and the numbers in those sections.

aboutMeTab.title: About Me
aboutMeTab.about: Hi, I'm Evie, a passionate and skilled software developer with a flair for innovation and a strong commitment to collaboration. As a trans individual, I bring a unique perspective and diversity to the tech industry, driving me to create inclusive and forward-thinking solutions. I am a recent gratuate from Southwest Technical College's Software Development program, who has been casually coding for years. When I decided to turn coding into a career I registered at the local tech college to make sure there wasn't anything I missed, and have since graduated and am looking for my first job in the field.
